'E-64' is an epoxide which can irreversibly inhibit a wide range of cysteine
peptidases.

The compound was first isolated and identified from Aspergillus japonicus in
1978. , and has since been shown to inhibit many
cysteine peptidases (e.g. papain, cathepsin B, cathepsin L, calpain and
staphopain).

The low toxic effects of the inhibitor, in addition to its effective mechanism
of action, makes E-64 a good template for drugs to treat diseases where high
levels of a cysteine proteases are the primary cause.
